channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wind Power in U.S. Faces Hit From Trump’s Executive Order
item.description: In a sweeping order, President Trump halted federal approvals for new wind farms, in a move that could affect projects on land and in the ocean.

item.title: Bimla Bissell, Vital Aide to Four U.S. Ambassadors to India, Dies at 92
item.description: Her house was a hub for generations of heads of state, diplomats, journalists and artists, who relied on her for her political acumen and were buoyed ...

item.title: Trump’s new memecoin and Trump Media stock are both plunging in a massive post-inauguration sell-off
item.description: Both assets have been accused of their value being disconnected from their financial performance.

item.title: Baton, led by a former Zillow executive, raises $10 million to help small businesses find buyers.
item.description: Baton’s clients include the well-known Brooklyn bakery L'imprimerie

item.title: Jeff Bezos’ fiancée Lauren Sánchez is being slammed for her inauguration outfit—igniting Gen Z’s ‘office siren’ debate and what’s appropriate for work
item.description: The “office siren” trend may have normalized the look, and the outfit could reflect a new culture of individualism in Trump’s administration.

item.title: Israel Embarks on an ‘Extensive’ Military Operation in the West Bank
item.description: The announcement came shortly after President Trump rescinded Biden-era sanctions on Israeli settlers and Jewish extremists raided Palestinian village...

item.title: Garth Hudson, Multifaceted Musician With the Band, Dies at 87
item.description: He was the last surviving original member of one of the most influential groups of the 1960s and ’70s, with its blend of rock, r&b and country.

item.title: Wind Power in U.S. Faces Hit From Trump’s Executive Order
item.description: In a sweeping order, President Trump halted federal approvals for new wind farms, in a move that could affect projects on land and in the ocean.

item.title: Last-Minute Settlement Talks Halt Prince Harry’s Trial Against Murdoch’s U.K. Tabloids
item.description: The case, which would represent the last major legal reckoning for victims and perpetrators of Britain’s phone hacking scandal, was adjourned until We...

item.title: Europe Braces for a New Trump Era, Uncertain About What It Means
item.description: President Trump appears willing to shake up almost every policy area, and a behind-the-scenes E.U. task force has been trying to prepare. But is Europ...

item.title: TikTokers’ panic revealed the lies they used to build careers and get millions of followers before the U.S. blackout: Now they’re backtracking as angry fans blast their fake videos
item.description: The confessions came back to haunt them once TikTok was back online.

item.title: John Lennon Came to My School When I Was 8. Or Did I Imagine It?
item.description: A story of hazy memories, a reluctant rock star and a mysterious woman.

item.title: 18 States Sue to Stop Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Order
item.description: The lawsuit to block the president’s executive order is the first salvo in what is likely to be a long-running legal fight over immigration policy.

item.title: Tax season 2025: Everything you need to know about deadlines, refunds, audits and more
item.description: IRS will begin accepting and processing 2024 returns on Jan. 27.
